The 7th provision and the only one the GOP supported:

This provision requires an annual report from DOJ that contains demographic data (race, age, etc.) of those determined to be ineligible to purchase a firearm based on a background check.

‚úÖ 160 Republicans voted for this ‚úÖ

The 4th provision: Safe Storage.

This provision included multiple bills that create federal standards for safe gun storage and establish real consequences for gun owners whose improper storage leads to death or injury.

‚ùå 203 Republicans voted against this ‚ùå

The 5th provision: The Closing the Bump Stock Loophole Act.

This provision regulates bump stocks, like the one used in Las Vegas that fired 1,000 shots into a crowd in the most deadly shooting in US history.

‚ùå 194 Republicans voted against this ‚ùå

The 6th provision: The Keep Americans Safe Act.

This provision prohibits the importation, sale, manufacture, transfer, or possession of a magazine that holds more than 15 rounds of ammo.

‚ùå 203 Republicans voted against this ‚ùå

The 2nd provision: The Prevent Gun Trafficking Act.

This bill is designed to combat illegal gun purchases and transfers ‚Äî making a new federal offense for those who purchase guns for someone who is legally unable to do so.

‚ùå 196 Republicans voted against this ‚ùå

The 3rd provision: The Untraceable Firearms Act.

This bill closes loopholes on ghost guns, ensuring that ghost guns, including 3D printed guns, are subject to existing federal firearm regulations.

‚ùå 193 Republicans voted against this ‚ùå

The 1st provision: The Raise the Age Act.

This bill raises the age to purchase semiautomatic guns to 21.

‚ùå 197 Republicans voted against this ‚ùå
